title: Craft and Structure

subtopics.heading: Vocabulary in Context
objectives: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in context.
Identify the tone and connotation of vocabulary used.
Distinguish between multiple meanings of a word based on sentence usage.

subtopics.heading: Text Structure and Purpose
objectives: Analyze how a text’s structure affects its meaning and impact.
Understand the function of paragraphs, sentences, and text features.
Identify the author's purpose or rhetorical strategy.

subtopics.heading: Point of View and Style
objectives: Recognize and analyze the narrator’s or speaker’s point of view.
Examine how point of view and style contribute to meaning.
Evaluate the impact of word choice and tone on the reader.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can interpret vocabulary and phrases in context.
Students can analyze text structure and author's craft.
Students can evaluate tone, style, and point of view.

title: Information and Ideas

subtopics.heading: Central Ideas and Details
objectives: Identify main ideas and supporting details.
Summarize key points and arguments from a text.
Differentiate between essential and nonessential information.

subtopics.heading: Inference and Evidence
objectives: Make logical inferences based on textual evidence.
Support conclusions with relevant details from the text.
Determine implications of statements and events in the passage.

subtopics.heading: Data Interpretation in Texts
objectives: Interpret information from charts, graphs, and data in context.
Integrate quantitative and qualitative data in text analysis.
Draw conclusions based on combined textual and visual data.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can determine central ideas and support them with details.
Students can make inferences and justify them with evidence.
Students can interpret visual and textual data combined.

title: Standard English Conventions

subtopics.heading: Sentence Structure and Boundaries
objectives: Recognize and correct sentence fragments and run-ons.
Use appropriate sentence boundaries for clarity and grammar.
Edit for parallel structure and modifier placement.

subtopics.heading: Usage and Agreement
objectives: Ensure subject-verb and pronoun-antecedent agreement.
Apply correct verb tense and pronoun case.
Identify and correct commonly confused words and idioms.

subtopics.heading: Punctuation and Mechanics
objectives: Use commas, semicolons, colons, and dashes correctly.
Apply punctuation rules for lists, compound sentences, and clauses.
Edit for quotation marks, apostrophes, and capitalization.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can construct grammatically correct and clear sentences.
Students can apply rules of agreement, tense, and pronoun use.
Students can edit writing for correct punctuation and mechanics.

title: Expression of Ideas

subtopics.heading: Clarity and Precision
objectives: Revise sentences for clarity and word economy.
Replace vague language with more precise or relevant wording.
Edit for redundancy and ambiguity.

subtopics.heading: Organization and Cohesion
objectives: Improve paragraph structure and logical flow.
Use transitions effectively to connect ideas.
Organize ideas to enhance coherence and readability.

subtopics.heading: Rhetorical Effectiveness
objectives: Revise texts to improve argumentation and persuasion.
Evaluate the effectiveness of examples and evidence.
Choose words and structures that strengthen impact.

expected_learning_outcomes: Students can revise texts for clarity and relevance.
Students can organize ideas logically and improve flow.
Students can strengthen writing for rhetorical impact.
